meanings.definition: To add moisture to the air.
meanings.sent1: I will humidify the room by placing a bowl of water near the heater.
meanings.sent2: During summer, the air conditioner helps to humidify the dry air in the house.
meanings.sent3: The plants in the greenhouse were so thirsty, they begged me to humidify the air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to humidify the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The humidifier worked wonders to humidify the parched air, making it more comfortable.

meanings.definition: To make something moist or damp.
meanings.sent1: Please humidify the soil before planting the seeds.
meanings.sent2: The rain will naturally humidify the dry earth in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The chef needed to humidify the cake to keep it fresh for the party.
meanings.sent4: His tears seemed to humidify the harsh words he had spoken earlier.
meanings.sent5: The morning dew helped to humidify the grass, making it cool and refreshing.
